body.p:
Elkton April 26th 1861 --
To his Excellency B Magoffin
Sir.

By a meeting of our Citizens on last evening, we were appointed a Committee for the purpose of Corresponding with you, to ascertain, Whether, if a Company is formed here for the purpose of aiding in the defence of Kentuckies honor,, her interests, and the Constitutional rights of her people,, -- the state will furnish them arms from the public armory or not, and when & how we can get them -- hopeing a prompt response to this we remain your friends and obt svts

John O McReynolds
John N. Bass
John L Davidson
G. Terry } Committee
Benjamin F. Butler
Answer as to others That the the law forbids the offering of arms to any, except those companies mustered into state Guard If we have them or They can get arms by so doing if We have them.

Elkton
Arms
Jno. McReynolds
And Apr 29 1861
